name: Horror Concept
description:
A concept of a horror game using the Unreal Engine 4 and the Horror Engine. This experience was created as a graduate Project/Portfolio course final project by Rocky Hernandez.

This game features two endings, puzzle/problem solving, out of the box thinking. The game was designed to give as little information as possible and nudge you slightly in the right direction. I am very interested to see what endings you get.

Here are the controls:

W/A/S/D: Movement

Q/E: Lean

Left Mouse: Primary interact (using, opening, on, off)

Right Mouse: Secondary Interact (Unlocking, pick up object, etc)

Space: Jump

CTRL: Crouch

Tab: Open Inventory

1: Pistol

2/G: Glowstick

3/F: Flashlight

4/V: Lighter

5/T: Torch

6/N: NVG (Night Vision Goggles)

7/C: Camera

Enjoy!

Disclaimer: This projects goal was to amplify my experience with using the Unreal Engine and to design/develop something new for my portfolio. I will be developing more onto this in the near future.

Tools/Assets used: Unreal Engine 4.24.3, Mixamo, Horror Engine asset, and Modular Victorian House asset.
